content.title: Intro
content.content: -t is a Quenya suffix that has three meanings.

content.title: -t1
content.content: Used as a dual ending, denoting a pair of something, e.g. máryat ("her [pair of] hands").[1]

content.title: -t2
content.content: A pronominal ending meaning "them", seen in the word laituvalmet ("we shall bless them"). Also independent word te, like in a laita të ("praise them").[2]

content.title: -t3
content.content: Used as a reduced pronominal affix of the 2nd person, "you" (singular). Found in heca ("be gone, stand aside"): hecat (singular) and hecal (plural).[3]
